words.fact: Snickerdoodles are cinnamon-sugar cookies with a crackled surface, believed to have German or Dutch origins and are a holiday favorite.
Gingerbread cookies date back to Medieval Europe and became a Christmas tradition thanks to the Brothers Grimm fairy tale Hansel and Gretel.
Peanut butter cookies with the classic fork crosshatch pattern became popular in America during the 1930s and are a Christmas cookie exchange staple.
Chocolate cookies, whether chocolate chip or double chocolate, are the most popular cookie flavor worldwide and a must-have during the holidays.
Molasses cookies are soft, chewy, and spiced with ginger and cinnamon - a traditional Christmas treat that fills your home with festive aromas.
